relevant_findings.HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic; PERRL; extraocular movements intact; moist mucous membranes; no conjunctival injection, pallor, or icterus
relevant_findings.Neck: No lymphadenopathy, no thyromegaly or nodules
relevant_findings.Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm; no murmurs, rubs, or gallops; normal S1 and S2
relevant_findings.Lungs: Bilateral basilar rales; no wheezes or rhonchi
relevant_findings.Abdomen: Positive guarding and rebound tenderness; tender to palpation in the right upper quadrant; bowel sounds present but sluggish
relevant_findings.Neurological: Cranial nerves II-XII intact; moves all four extremities; antalgic gait due to abdominal pain; otherwise normal

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vital signs show a slight reduction in heart rate and blood pressure from initial assessment to admission.
